argument.description: The value used to find the largest integer value.

description: The PostgreSQL floor function returns the largest integer value that is equal to or less than a number.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT floor(32.65);
 floor
-------
    32
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT floor(32.1);
 floor
-------
    32
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT floor(32);
 floor
-------
    32
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT floor(-32.65);
 floor
-------
   -33
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT floor(-32.1);
 floor
-------
   -33
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT floor(-32);
 floor
-------
   -32
(1 row)
